MemberSignature.Value: public static int BinarySearch (Java.Lang.Object[] a, Java.Lang.Object key);
.method public static hidebysig int32 BinarySearch(class Java.Lang.Object[] a, class Java.Lang.Object key) cil managed
static member BinarySearch : Java.Lang.Object[] * Java.Lang.Object -> int

Docs.param: the array to be searched
the value to be searched for
Docs.summary: Searches the specified array for the specified object using the binary search algorithm.
Docs.returns: index of the search key, if it is contained in the array; otherwise, (-(insertion point) - 1). The insertion point is defined as the point at which the key would be inserted into the array: the index of the first element greater than the key, or a.length if all elements in the array are less than the specified key. Note that this guarantees that the return value will be >= 0 if and only if the key is found.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if an element in the array or the search element does not implement Comparable, or cannot be compared to each other.

Docs.param: the first array to compare

Docs.summary: Compares two Object arrays, within comparable elements, lexicographically.
Docs.returns: the value 0 if the first and second array are equal and contain the same elements in the same order; a value less than 0 if the first array is lexicographically less than the second array; and a value greater than 0 if the first array is lexicographically greater than the second array
